  • CPython No-GIL åˆ†æ”¯
    • GITHUB.COM/COLESBURY
    • â€¢ Shared by Henry Schreiner

This is a proof-of-concept implementation of CPython that supports multithreading without the global interpreter lock (GIL), from Facebook research. An overview of the design is described in the Python Multithreading without the GIL Google doc. Also see the related discussions on LWN and Hacker News.

entry.content:
TIOBEæ›°: Python æˆä¸º #1

    • SLASHDOT.ORG

ZDNet reports that Python â€œis now the most popular language, according to one popularity ranking.â€ â€œFor the first time in more than 20 years we have a new leader of the packâ€¦â€ the TIOBE Index announced this month. â€œThe long-standing hegemony of Java and C is over.â€

(æ˜¯ä¹Ÿä¹:

å¾ˆä¹…æ²¡è§ SLASHDOT/. çš„æ¶ˆæ¯äº†...

)

  • Python C API: æ·»åŠ å‡½æ•°ä»¥è®¿é—® pyObject
    • VICTOR STINNER

â€œThe PyObject structure prevents indirectly to optimize CPython. We will see why and how I prepared the C API to make this structure opaque. It took me 1 year and a half to add functions and to introduce incompatible C API changes (fear!)â€

  • Improve Inefficient App Code With Datadog Application Performance Monitoring
    • DATADOG
    • sponsor

Datadogâ€™s Continuous Profiler allows you to measure code performance changes over time. Quickly identify and optimize the most time- and resource-consuming parts in your application code in order to improve MTTR and enhance user experience. Give it a try with a free trial â†’

  • ç”¨ Pygame åœ¨ Python ä¸­æ„å»ºå°è¡Œæ˜Ÿæ¸¸æˆ

In this course, youâ€™ll build a clone of the Asteroids game in Python using Pygame. Step by step, youâ€™ll add images, input handling, game logic, sounds, and text to your program.

  • Representing Rational Numbers With Python Fractions
    • REAL PYTHON

In this tutorial, youâ€™ll learn about the Fraction data type in Python, which can represent rational numbers precisely without the rounding errors in binary arithmetic. Youâ€™ll find that this is especially important in financial and other high-precision applications.

  • ç”¨ print() è°ƒè¯•çš„æŠ€è‰º

â€œIf youâ€™re embarrassed at debugging with print(), please donâ€™t be - itâ€™s perfectly fine! Many bugs are easily tackled with just a few checks in the right places. As much as I love using a debugger, I often reach for a print() statement first.â€

  • Pythonâ€™s sum() : æ±‚ SUM å€¼çš„ Pythonic æ–¹æ³•

In this step-by-step tutorial, youâ€™ll learn how to use Pythonâ€™s sum() function to add numeric values together. You also learn how to concatenate sequences, such as lists and tuples, using sum().
